title: Toad in the hole with red onion gravy
tip: To guarantee a perfectly puffed-up Yorkshire, add the batter when the oil is smoking hot, and don't open the oven door until it's cooked through.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180˚C, gas mark 4. Start by making the gravy.
Keeping the gravy warm, put the oil in a small roasting tray (about 1 litre in volume), add the sausages, and toss to coat. Roast for 15-20 minutes, turning halfway through, until browned.

For the batter, put the flour in a bowl and make a well in the centre. Add the eggs and half the milk; beat to a thick batter. Gradually whisk in the remaining milk, season well and leave to rest for at least 15 minutes.

Increase the oven temperature to 200˚C, gas mark 6. Add the rosemary sprigs to the sausages, then pour in the batter. Quickly return to the oven for 20-25 minutes until the batter is cooked through and well puffed. Serve with the onion gravy and some mash and green vegetables.
imageDesc: A roasting tray filled with well-cooked batter and crispy-skinned sausages, scattered with rosemary.
